website_summaries.verdict: This lightweight bag packs small and has a hood for extra warmth.
pros: Styled to fit over the top of the head for more warmth at night
Includes a pocket inside for keeping small items like glasses or a flashlight close
Durable material and good construction on this sleeping bag
cons: Some users complained about the thin lining

customer_reviews.title: Great camping bag for kids up to 5ft.
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag worked very well for a camp out night for a 9 year old. Easy to operate, the zippers are solid, looks to be well made and provided plenty of heat during a 50F night. Based on the size I would guess kids up to 5ft could probably use it - but I would start looking at the next size up for a kid 4ft6inches, as a 5ft tall kid would be kind of at the limit of being able to stretch his legs inside without popping out. Very pleased with the bag, I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: C. Gafton

customer_reviews.title: Being a woman at only 5' 2", traditional adult ...
customer_reviews.text: Being a woman at only 5' 2", traditional adult sleeping bags simply too long and ridiculously bulky. This one fits me perfectly, packs perfectly and keeps me warm for this fall season of camping.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy E.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Used for my tall toddler (almost 5 yrs old and wears a size 6/7 in clothes if that helps) when we went camping by Lake Chelan, WA in August. Was warm during the day/early evening and got pretty chilly at night. He slept well all night long and didn't complain about being too hot or too cold. Bag is roomy enough for it to grow with him.
customer_reviews.author: Mara

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bags!
customer_reviews.text: We have 1 Teton Junior sleeping bag of each color for our kids. We camp a lot & these have been great for our kids. All of our kids are in between toddler & adult sizes: these pack easily, aren't too bulky, keep the kids warm, and are the perfect size for young kids!
customer_reviews.author: RKJones

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job!
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for a quasi-camping trip (bunks in a cabin) for a kindergartner, especially considering the price point which is lower than other sleeping bags. I am hoping the temperature rating is accurate but have not yet had a chance to test it at that cold temperature. So far am happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Ponyo

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and well made
customer_reviews.text: This is well made and really warm. We camped in 30 some odd degree weather and it kept my son so toasty he actually had to cool off a bit in the night haha! All though he had a liner in there and a fuzzy blanket. So the next night we just did the liner and the sleeping bag and it was plenty warm. It would have probably been warm enough without the liner (something we bought separate) but he's a little guy so I did it just to be on the safe side. It rolls up nice and we had no issues with it. It's a nice sleeping bag, I would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: This sleeping bag it pretty large for a toddler but it will last him ...
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag it pretty large for a toddler but it will last him quite a while and I am happy with it. The sack it comes with is a very tight fit, that's the only downside, I might get a compression sack that will fit it better.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin Lafavour

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag but lacks some of the features we like in a sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag worked quite well for our 2 year old. We went camping up at Yellowstone and it got down to 30F at night and she slept through the night in this thing. I felt like it might be a bit narrow, especially for an older kid, and I was sad it didn’t have the flannel lining like some of our other bags. It also has no drawstring to close the top either, which most of our colder weather bags have. Overall, though, it did it’s job. We did put an extra blanket in the bag on her, mostly to keep her warm at the opening of the bag, but a bigger kid may not have needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality sleeping bag. Better than anything I had as a kid. Our kids (4y boy, 2y girl) loved theirs when they got them for Christmas and regularly go "camping" in their bedrooms or the family room. Waterproofing and insulation seem like they'd stay comfortable in the 20F's, but we'll never camp with the kids that young in those temps. I'm sure they'll be fine in 50F-60F Spring-Fall VA nights. Note: Very slippery for adults to step on around the house. Packs easily in the accompanying stuff sack.
customer_reviews.author: Matt O

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good, warm sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.text: In the PNW it can get chilly at night- even in the summer. Bought this for my tall 3 yr old for tent camping & he has tons of room to grow with this bag. He was warm enough on a recent trip near the sound -even in cotton pjs. My only complaint is that it can be very slippery. He moves around a lot in his sleep and he ended up twisting the zipper to the top middle of his body. It also takes quite a bit of muscle/energy/time to get it back in the bag it comes with. We may ditch the bag for straps eventually.
customer_reviews.author: reeces

customer_reviews.title: Nice sleeping bag.  Terrible storage bag.
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our son mainly for sleepovers. Whether it works in freezing temps isn't a concern. He loved the look and the size and comfort is perfect. The biggest issue is the ridiculously small bag. I knew the minute I took the sleeping bag out the first time we'd never get it back in. After multiple tries with my husband and I working together to roll it tight enough we are ditching the bag.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wieczorek

customer_reviews.title: Nice and snug
customer_reviews.text: Can’t really complain. Kept my 6 year old snug as a bug on a night when temps dropped down to 39°. She slept soundly, even though we had far from logical sleeping pads for that weather (yoga mats, we had yoga mats.) Rolled up nicely and went back in its pouch. Just wish it came in better colors.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Davidson

customer_reviews.title: I'm a short girl (4'11) so for me this fits ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a short girl (4'11) so for me this fits perfectly, but the width is a little tight if you're used to having more room to move around in.
customer_reviews.author: KTLe

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag for small kids.
customer_reviews.text: Teton makes the best sleeping bags for the price and quality. This is a junior sleeping bag so its great for small kids. A must have for all camping trips!
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: Lining is loose on the inside so it grabs at your clothing and catches when you try to roll over. The outer material is loud. When sharing a tent with kids that move all night long, it is annoying to hear this slippery sound constantly. The bag is warm and comfortable overall and served our needs well on a cold weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Steejo

customer_reviews.title: Great kids sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Our five-year-old son slept like a baby in this thing, kept him warm in 40°F weather with rain all night. Plenty of room for him to grow into. Looks like it will hold up great.
customer_reviews.author: Blademaster103

customer_reviews.title: Warm, soft
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag for my son, age 11, a boy scout. It's a good size for him packs smaller than our adult cold-weather bags. He struggled a bit to pack it into the provided sack, but it does fit. He was warm enough to sleep well on a rainy, 30-degree overnight campout.
customer_reviews.author: BF, Austin

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: my daughter did complain of feeling cold at around 32F so not sure how effective this is ...
customer_reviews.author: romit

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson used this sleeping bag on his first Boy Scout camping trip. It was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Pinkyblue

customer_reviews.title: Fits a 5ft. Person
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag. Definitely keeps you warm. Also another plus it fit me perfectly as I am an 5ft. Woman. If you’re someone that tosses and turn in your sleep you may find this bag a little hard to move around in as it is snug in a good way!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Richter

customer_reviews.title: Kept my 7-year old warm in the 30 degree temperature ...
customer_reviews.text: Kept my 7-year old warm in the 30 degree temperature. He even praised me for keeping him warm. One for dad!!
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Arce

customer_reviews.title: great quality sleeping bags
customer_reviews.text: great quality sleeping bags. like the fact that kids won't outgrow fast enough as it is longer than typical kids sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: jh

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: My 11 yo son took to camp. He said it was comfy and fit him well. He is 57 inches. Camp was in early September
customer_reviews.author: Price4

customer_reviews.title: Cozy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for Girl Scout camping trip. Was comfortable and warm.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t stay warm
customer_reviews.text: It says it will keep you warm down to 20 degrees. Did not stay warm even at 35 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my four year old grandson. I bought it for his first camping trip. Temperatures dropped to the low 50’s and sleep snag as a bug. We are very happy with the sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Beth H Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Keeps The Little Ones Warm
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son (3 yreas old) to go camping. He loves it and it's rated for 20°F. My daughter (5 years old) has the pink one and they stayed warm when camping in 40°F overnight.
customer_reviews.author: magilla060

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice sleeping bag, it keep my son warm camping at Big Bear last winter.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bag was exactly what it said it was- grandson was thrilled!
customer_reviews.author: janet farrar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 7 old daughter. Its perfect. She can easily grow into this till I'm guessing 10/11. Great quality. Solid zipper. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Jinks

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Decent sleeping bag but can't handle the cold as it says.
customer_reviews.author: Jerad

customer_reviews.title: Nice for a cheap first sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Nice first sleeping bag for my son. Carrying case is an extra bonus rather than having to roll it perfect
customer_reviews.author: Kyle S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality! Buy it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent high quality sleeping bag!! Very nice! Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent bag that is only a little bit light for its rated warmth.
customer_reviews.text: Good sleeping bag for boys up to about 65 inches tall. The survival rating is +20 deg F, but a young boy will only feel comfortable in this down to about 35 deg F. Although, a liner will add about another 10 deg of warmth. Built a little bit light but easy to roll up and comes with its own carrying bag. About 4.5 out of 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: A. Aurelius

customer_reviews.title: "Warm & Toasty"
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sleeping bag for my Cub Scout. On our second outing with this we had a Polar Bear night with temps well below freezing and he was not cold. "Warm & Toasty". Also contrary to the instructions it does wash and dry well in the machine, just keep it on a gentle cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Steely

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Really nice quality sleeping bags for the money. They are kids bags and fit kids up to 5'1". I would absolutely recommend these bags. It kept my girls warm and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cocoon style but warm
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize it was a cocoon type, bottom stays closed, only zips down the side and inside is satiny fabric but it keeps you warm in the cold
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: My girls
customer_reviews.text: My 2 daughters use these sleeping bags all the time and love them, haven't heard a complaint about warmth
customer_reviews.author: Cody Mcfarland

customer_reviews.title: Cold at 32, but warm enough at 40+
customer_reviews.text: My son was too cold in 32 degree weather, but was warm enough in 45 degree weather. I think it is a good moderate weather bag for scout camping.
customer_reviews.author: D&R

customer_reviews.title: Was perfect fit for my 10 year old son
customer_reviews.text: Was perfect fit for my 10 year old son. He absolutely loves his new sleeping bag and can't wait to use it for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: My some used this while camping this fall. It was about 30 degrees and kept him warm
customer_reviews.author: Tajomaru

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this bag! My daughter is 2 1/2 and very tall for her age, the bag has plenty of room for her to grow in the coming years. Soft and cozy warm. Good quality, no issues with craftsmanship. Would definitely purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Gina S.

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag for our children! They have plenty of room to grow into it for years to come which saves us money, as so many of the "kid" sleeping bags are small and get outgrown fairly fast. It's easy to store and the inside gets nice and toasty; it's also a cute color combo which the girls in our family appreciate :)
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Nice for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: Good quality bag but rather small even for a junior size. Unless you're buying for a toddler I recommend just getting a standard size sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: KDG

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought my daughter her first big girl sleeping bag for her Girl Scouts camping trip. She loved it and said it kept her warm all night.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bags for the kids
customer_reviews.text: The kids love these bags, and although they aren't super pretty to look at, they keep them super warm. The included stuff sack gets them down to a nice small 6"x12" size, which is also handy for packing on trips. Would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff

customer_reviews.title: Not a serious sleeping bag ... duh?
customer_reviews.text: Kind of bulky and not all that warm, I got it for my 5' tall girlfriend and it's the same size as my extra long mummy bag (which is also a 20 degree bag)
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P. Geach

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old grandson used it for camping. It w as s just the right size
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a sleeping bag for both my 6 and 4 year old and am very happy with the product. There is plenty of room to grow and get many more years of use out of them. The lining is a softer fleece material which they say is "comfy".
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love all their bags. We have Teton Sport bags. Use them for camping and at home. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Great Youth Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: Kids love their new sleeping bags. Good quality, easy to zip, soft and warm liner. However, very hard to stuff back into sack it came with. I had to have my husband put it back in. I miss the old elastic bands to keep sleeping bags in place 😀
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Far too lightweight for suggested temperatures. Smaller than advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what makes it for girls in the first place but it's smaller and lighter than stated. Might be fine for a sleepover but not for any night of camping that I've been on.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Frisbie

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: My son loved it took it camping to big bear and told me it kept him warm over night with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Great for my daughter
customer_reviews.text: this is a great sleeping bag, kept my daughter warm in the cold nights we camped in Yellowstone!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley M Salisbury

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Quality seems very nice thus far.looking forward to using it while camping.
customer_reviews.author: Kim S

customer_reviews.title: Teton sport jr kid sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Just recieved it today. Open it up and notice there was a rip/ tear inside the sleeping bag. The sleeping bag is very thin and cheaply made. Very disappointed. I have also attached a photo to support it.
customer_reviews.author: caree

customer_reviews.title: and this was the perfect size for me
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 5'0" woman, and this was the perfect size for me! I wish the pink/brown had been in stock, but I have no complaints about the bag. On our last trip, the temp got down into the low 20's and I was comfortable in our tent.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barlow

customer_reviews.title: This bag was slightly thicker than the princess bag in ...
customer_reviews.text: This bag was slightly thicker than the princess bag in my daughter's closet. I can't imagine it really being warm down to 20 degrees. I also was hoping the top could tighten as a hood. It is just an area for a pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Elsa

customer_reviews.title: Small bag, doesn't unzip to lay flat
customer_reviews.text: Sleeping bag is good quality. It is not a full size sleeping bag and should only be used for a child (maybe up to 10 years old). My major complaint is that the zipper doesn't unzip all the way to permit it to lay flat.
customer_reviews.author: A. Anttila

customer_reviews.title: The best sleeping bag you can buy at this price
customer_reviews.text: The best sleeping bag you can buy at this price! It's not the ultra-light gear but it's the lightest at this price. I used it in a 25F environment. Felt a bit chill but i slept okay with my base layer on. You will feel super warm if you keep your fleece on.
customer_reviews.author: Sjshdbdidhen

customer_reviews.title: Boys (5 & 7) love the sleeping bags
customer_reviews.text: Boys (5 & 7) love the sleeping bags, they are warm. If sleeping in doors they needed to unzip the size a bit to keep cool. Built very well and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: but I am disappointed it didn't come with straps to close it up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Grandson for camping with the boy scouts. He loves it, but I am disappointed it didn't come with straps to close it up, which I recently found out. So now I am on the hunt for closing straps
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Outside lining
customer_reviews.text: The outside lining is TOO noisy for a child that moves alot in there sleep. The inside is perfect, soft,comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Reichoff

customer_reviews.title: It worked great. He did say it was very warm
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old used it for a camping trip in California. It worked great. He did say it was very warm, and I should not have bought this warm sleeping bag with the warm California temperature. Otherwise, it worked as promised.
customer_reviews.author: KeepIt1Hunnid

customer_reviews.title: Great item we use this for our 4 year old ...
customer_reviews.text: Great item we use this for our 4 year old son, it works as described, not for backpacking camping but great for car camping
customer_reviews.author: Tonatiuh Fernandez Camacho

customer_reviews.title: Not age appropriate!
customer_reviews.text: Too hard to put sleeping bag back in outside bag for an adult (never mind a child)!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: would be perfect if it came with a compression sack
customer_reviews.text: would be perfect if it came with a compression sack. Best deal I found, child loves it. My son is 5, about 43" tall. It fits him well and plenty of room to "squirm". Not to heavy for backpacking, but had to purchase a separate compression sack to get it as small as possible and it still had to be strapped to the outside of his pack.
customer_reviews.author: thomas hyde

customer_reviews.title: Warm and light weight
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag. Very well made and extremely warm but still light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my girl scout granddaughter. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Toby Norman

customer_reviews.title: My boys were cold and required an extra blanket or ...
customer_reviews.text: My boys were cold and required an extra blanket or fleece liner. It was barely 40 degrees. Also who puts the slippery type outside on a kids sleeping bag. It was slip and slide all night. Otherwise very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Antonino B Cifaldi

customer_reviews.title: Love it - thought it was strange though that there ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it - thought it was strange though that there are no tie straps to secure before trying to cram back into the unforgiving bag :-)
customer_reviews.author: Tarina

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the kids 👍
customer_reviews.text: The boy loves this bag. Significant upgrade from the cartoon bags that all kids seem to get from Grandma.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for a kid.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our daughter last summer. Kept her warm all through our 3-seasons of camping. She is now 2yrs old so we should get plenty of use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Good bag to grow into!
customer_reviews.text: My son had his second camping trip in the Rockies with this bag and was totally comfortable! It was late August.
customer_reviews.author: AH79

customer_reviews.title: Won't last long but she can pack it in
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 7 year old perfectly and is warm enough for chilly nights in the mountains of North east Washington.
customer_reviews.author: homeschoolmom5Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Sleepin' sound!
customer_reviews.text: Item just as described, but so much better in person! Loved it! Packaged well and shipped fast!
customer_reviews.author: LORI

customer_reviews.title: Not true Flannel lining:(
customer_reviews.text: Very dissappointing for Mom fortunately the boy loved it. Notes: flannel is not really flannel it's brushed polyester. No straps to hold it when rolled up. Nearly impossible to put back in bag. Very narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Libriskat

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: amazing bag and my kids keep warm. bought 2 of them and love the quality
customer_reviews.author: Chad Moroni

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: velcro on the closure tab ripped immediately but otherwise it's a decent bag.
customer_reviews.author: Kim B.

customer_reviews.title: Very cute & comfortable. I also purchased a matching pillow
customer_reviews.text: Very cute & comfortable. I also purchased a matching pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves her sleeping bag, and it keeps her warm at night.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Very warm bag for my 3 yr old!
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag was excellent! Took it camping and kept my daughter warm all night at high altitudes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... to go to camp and he said it worked great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for me son to go to camp and he said it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: It's the best for many reasons!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my tall six year old's first indoor sleepover party! Just the right length with plenty room to grow. And the right temperature as he usually hot during thenight.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Good junior size sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Bag is very nice. Only complaint is that the storage bag is too tight for a kid to be able to use. It must be rolled exactly right to fit! Keeps kids warm though.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette G. Vargo

customer_reviews.title: Super cute and very warm
customer_reviews.text: Super cute and very warm. We have both the blue and pink versions for our kids. I've been very impressed with the quality and they have held up to all the abuse my kids put them through!
customer_reviews.author: Happy camper

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, well-made. Packaging held up well
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Grandson was thrilled and said it was very comfy
customer_reviews.author: VA Gammie

customer_reviews.title: Large size for a kids bag- which is great! We have the adult bags in this style
customer_reviews.text: Seems warm. Large size for a kids bag- which is great! We have the adult bags in this style. We really like them. The inside is NOT fleece/flannel material, just print on a soft/silky fabric. Only complaint, when i opened the box i saw a HUGE black beetle snuggled in, on the outside bag! ! It freaked me out! I was going to flick it into the toilet and in doing so realized it was long dead. Creeped me out so i thoroughly inspected the whole thing and washed it right away.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal G.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice small bag for a grandson. I wish I had ordered two of these for both my grandsons.
customer_reviews.author: Evonne J. Stites

customer_reviews.title: Great fo kids
customer_reviews.text: Need bigger stuff sack. Impossible to get back into bag.
customer_reviews.author: Aspenchick

customer_reviews.title: Child sleeping back you can actually use camping.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect sleeping bag for my 3 year old although a little long but room to grow. Purchased because most of the sleeping bags for this age group (Children) were indoor and won't be warm enough for the outdoors. We tested it with a backyard camp out and it worked great. The lining isn't heavy flannel but also not the slinky material so often found in sleeping bags so my little guy, who sweats in his sleep, was really comfortable. Additionally my husband now has sleeping bag envy and we will need to get him a new one soon. Great purchase for families with children that need a "real" sleeping back for the great outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, this bag didn't keep us warm in 38 degree weather.
customer_reviews.author: A. David

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: perfect size for my grandson who is a cub scout!
customer_reviews.author: Celia May  Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not so sure about the -7/ 20F rating. The sleeping bag seem way too thin for 20F.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh W.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A very good sleeping bag for my grandson to grow with...super comfortable and compact!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great kids sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 6 year-old son. We took it on his first camping trip recently and it was perfect. We had a little of everything: some warm nights, cold rainy nights, and this bag was very comfortable for him in all conditions. He loved it. The quality also seems excellent on it and I anticipate having this for many more trips to come. Hopefully we'll be able to hand it down to his little brother when he outgrows it.
customer_reviews.author: Cweb

customer_reviews.title: i really like this one for my 6 years old son
customer_reviews.text: i really like this one for my 6 years old son.he can carry this one that much light weight. and easy to carry as well.
customer_reviews.author: Yang Soon Kwon

customer_reviews.title: Love TETON!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 4 of these bags for our daughters to use during our family vacation this past Spring Break, We have since used these bags on about 3 more trips. We purchased the TETON Queen Size sleeping bag at the beginning of this year and our love for it brought us back to TETON for our kiddos! You won't be disappointed with these!
customer_reviews.author: Broken Oak Acre

customer_reviews.title: perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: very nice sleeping bag. perfect for camping and even camping "indoors" . well worth the money and very easy transaction
customer_reviews.author: hopeless romantic

customer_reviews.title: These are great first time sleeping bags for warmer weather camping
customer_reviews.text: These are great first time sleeping bags for warmer weather camping, backyard camping and sleepovers at their friends houses. They pack down nicely and the stuff sack does what it's made for. My only complaint (kind of?) is the velcro at the top of the zipper is big and a little rough on the edges so it could scratch your little ones face a bit. Nothing big, more of an irritation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: TETON Sports Celsius Jr Kids Sleeping Bag; Lightweight; Perfect for Camping
product_meta.description: The TETON Sports Celsius Jr. Kids Sleeping Bag is perfect for car, RV and cabin camping. It’s longer than most kid’s sleeping bags so your child can use it for more of the growing up years. Designed with the same materials as the highly-rated TETON Sports adult sleeping bags, Celsius Jr. will keep your child warm and comfortable so you can sleep through the night.
feature_bullets: COMFORTABLE: Will keep your child warm and comfortable so you can sleep through the night; Sturdy sleeping bag with taffeta shell that is durable, easy to pack, and great for campouts and sleepovers
NEVER ROLL YOUR SLEEPING BAG AGAIN: TETON Sports provides a durable stuff sack for stuffing your kid’s sleeping bag into; Just start at the bottom of the sleeping bag and stuff the bag in
BUILT WITH YOUR KID IN MIND: Full-length zipper draft tube holds the warm air in; Convenient pocket in the lining to store a phone or flashlight; Sturdy two-way zippers; Single-layer construction
SLEEP WARM: Fluff your sleeping bag and use an insulated camp pad to sleep warmer; Hang loops for long-term storage to maintain maximum loft
TETON SPORTS PROMISE: Reach out to our AMAZING product support team if you have any questions or concerns; YOU CAN COUNT ON US to get you taken care of and back OUTDOORS with TETON Sports
